title: RestClientDefinitionException: Parameters and variables don't match, with `@Path("")` on interface
body:
### Describe the bug

There are a couple of ways to trigger:

First way:

1. The interface has `@Path("")`.
2. The interface has a method with `@Path` starting with "/" and having a path parameter in the first component of the path (e.g. `@Path("/{id}")`).

Second way:

1. The interface has `@Path("/")`
2. The interface has a method with `@Path` that starts with a path param and no "/" prefix (e.g. `@Path("{id}")`).



### Expected behavior

REST client should pass validation.

### Actual behavior

REST client does not pass validation.

### How to Reproduce?

See `rest-client-validation-bug` on https://github.com/kahowell/quarkus-quickstarts.git

Steps:
1. `quarkus dev` from `rest-client-quickstart`
2. `http :8080/extension/id/foo`

Observe stacktrace.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux p1gen2 6.3.5-100.fc37.x86_64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Tue May 30 15:43:51 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.7" 2023-04-18 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (Red_Hat-17.0.7.0.7-4.fc37) (build 17.0.7+7) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (Red_Hat-17.0.7.0.7-4.fc37) (build 17.0.7+7, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.1.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.6 (84538c9988a25aec085021c365c560670ad80f63) Maven home: /home/khowell/.m2/wrapper/dists/apache-maven-3.8.6-bin/67568434/apache-maven-3.8.6 Java version: 17.0.7, vendor: Red Hat, Inc., runtime: /usr/lib/jvm/java-17-openjdk-17.0.7.0.7-5.fc37.x86_64 Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8 OS name: "linux", version: "6.3.5-100.fc37.x86_64", arch: "amd64", family: "unix"

### Additional information

I attached a debugger, and it appears to be due to URL parsing inside of `QuarkusRestClientBuilder.verifyInterface`. I suspect this might be fixed by using `new ResteasyUriBuilderImpl().path()` rather than `new ResteasyUriBuilderImpl().uri()` I may open a PR for this later on.

Appears to affect 2.16 series as well.
